project.name: Atlas Mobile
project.scope: Cross-platform app, feature flags, offline sync

sections.title: Project Context & Role Clarity
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee’s understanding of Atlas Mobile’s pilot phase goals and their specific UX responsibilities.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your role in the Atlas Mobile project and how it ties into the pilot phase objectives?
What are the primary UX deliverables you are accountable for in this phase?
How do you measure success for your UX work in the context of our mission and values?

sections.title: UX Research & Accessibility Approach
sections.goal: Explore the research methods, accessibility standards, and design system integration applied in the project.
sample_questions: What user research methods have you employed to validate our cross-platform approach?
How have you ensured compliance with accessibility requirements during the pilot?
Can you describe how the DS-ATLAS v2 Tokenized Components have influenced your design decisions?

sections.title: Feature Flags & Offline Sync Design
sections.goal: Understand the UX considerations for implementing feature flags and offline sync capabilities.
sample_questions: How do you prioritize which features to expose via flags during the pilot?
What UX challenges have you encountered with offline sync, and how have you addressed them?
Have you coordinated with SRE or Platform teams to align UX with technical constraints for offline mode?

sections.title: Cross-team Collaboration & Evidence-based Decisions
sections.goal: Assess collaboration with other departments and the use of runbooks, RFCs, and SLAs in UX decision-making.
sample_questions: Can you give an example of a decision where input from the Mobile and Security departments was critical?
How do you incorporate artifacts like runbooks or RFCs into your UX planning?
Have you used any SLA requirements to influence design trade-offs?

sections.title: Risk Management & Iteration Planning
sections.goal: Discuss how risks are identified, documented, and mitigated in the UX domain, especially given pilot constraints.
sample_questions: What are the top UX-related risks you foresee as we transition from pilot to build/scale?
How do you document and communicate these risks to stakeholders?
Can you share an example where you had to choose between two UX approaches due to a risk constraint, and what evidence supported your choice?
